transcripts.text: For the last four years, members of the mainstream media, political pundits, Democrats, and so-called psychiatric experts have been running with the narrative that Donald Trump is mentally unfit and unsound to be President of the United States.  What we see increasingly is a president who is under pressure, out of his depth, ignorant, unprepared, and fundamentally unfit for the office.  And this is apparent to everybody.
I think the man has very limited memory and very limited vocabulary.
All of that can be seen as psychiatric.  There's such severe mental decline going on.
With the zigzagging of his brain from one topic to another, sometimes really utter nonsense.
Delusional and sick.  This is a man.
who obviously is not fit to hold the office.  And we've known that for a very long time.
It is not normal for us to be talking about whether the president has a mental stability issue.
And yet that's been going on now for quite a while, hasn't it?
No, no, it's not normal.  All of this chatter is designed to undermine President Trump.  Take, for example, this clip from MSNBC's Rachel Maddow.

The president right now in the midst of this crisis is visibly struggling.  There is something wrong or he's just not doing okay.  I don't know.  But the president apparently just is not able to keep it together right now in his public appearances.

Maddow is referring to the following clip of a White House press briefing where Trump called on CBS's Weijia Zhang.  Let's watch and break it down.  Many times that the US is doing far better than any other country when it comes to testing.
Yes.  Why does that matter?

This is a very dishonest question and she knows it.  At the beginning of the health crisis, President Trump and the administration was criticized over the lack of testing for a virus that didn't exist until a few months prior.  Cut to a few months later and the United States has conducted more tests for the virus than every other country in the world.  So when Trump touts the number of tests conducted, this is an effort to quell that criticism.  But Weijia Zhang attempted to turn a positive into a negative.  Why is this a global competition to you if every day Americans are still losing their lives and we're still seeing more cases every day?  This is not a legitimate question.  This is grandstanding.

Well, they're losing their lives everywhere in the world.  And maybe that's a question you should ask China.  Don't ask me, ask China that question, okay?  When you ask them that question, you may get a very unusual answer.

So Trump gave a response to Weijia's question, then called on CNN's Caitlin Collins.  But Weijia decided after a few seconds that she had an opportunity to pretend that Trump was attacking her personally because she was born in China.
Yes, behind you, please.
Sir, why are you saying that to me specifically?
I'm telling you, I'm not saying it specifically to anybody.  I'm saying it to anybody who would ask a nasty question like that.  That's not a nasty question.  Please go ahead.

Why does it matter?  Someone's triggered and it's not Trump, that's for sure.  Now, since Caitlin Collins took so long to ask her question and let Ouija keep bickering, the president called on someone else.  And instead of Collins getting mad at Ouija, she fought back against the president.
Okay, anybody else?  Please, go ahead in the back, please.  The Press.  I have two questions.  The President.  No, it's okay.  We'll go over here.  The Press.  But you pointed to me.
I have two questions, Mr.  President.
The President Next.  Next, please.
The Press.  But you called on me.
The President.  I did, and you didn't respond, and now I'm calling on The young lady in the back, please.

I just wanted to let my colleague.  So instead of Caitlin Collins just taking the L, she thought that it was totally appropriate to argue with the president of the United States.  And in turn, Trump decided to wash his hands of this nonsense and end it.
Ladies and gentlemen, thank you very much.  Appreciate it.  Thank you very much.
So Trump thanked everyone and calmly walked off.  But hang on.  Remember how Rachel Maddow started off her segment saying that Trump was struggling and couldn't keep it together?
The president apparently just is not able to keep it together.  The president right now is visibly struggling.  There is something wrong or he's just not doing okay.
I don't know.  Then she showed the exact same exchange that I showed with Weijia and Collins.  And when it finished, Maddow had this to say about the president.
What is wrong with the president today?  It's clear that there's something wrong.  And that's important whenever the president of the United States is visibly unwound.

If anyone was unwound in that whole exchange, it was Weijia Zhang.  And I would like to point out that Trump had taken questions from reporters for 38 minutes and only ended it after a couple of harpies decided that they were going to bicker with the President of the United States.  But like everything wrong in the world, it's Trump's fault.  Another talking point is that Trump is not of sound mind and that he's going to start a war, or worse.  A lot of people have commented on the fact, obviously, he's the leader of the free world.  He has his finger, Dr.  Lee, on the nuclear button.  How dangerous is that?  Did you see a sign of danger of such a man having control over the nuclear codes?  Yes, absolutely.
